text:
An establishment which ships livestock
only for itself is not such a public stockyard as to constitute a “common
carrier” within Part I of the Interstate Commerce Act, and consequently is not
within the FLSA Sec l3(b)(2) exemption.
html: An establishment which ships livestock only for itself is not such a public stockyard as to constitute a “common carrier” within Part I of the Interstate Commerce Act, and consequently is not within the FLSA Sec l3(b)(2) exemption.
